title: Losses pile up at OnTheMarket
text:
Online estate agent OnTheMarket has suffered widening losses as it fights to take on established rivals Rightmove and Zoopla.

The firm lost £7.1m in the six months to July 31, compared with £5.7m a year earlier.

However, it claimed the number of visits to its website grew by three-quarters to 121 million during the period – suggesting it is giving up profits in an effort to boost growth. The firm's cash balance dropped to £8.8m, almost halving since the start of the year.

Ian Springett, chief executive, insisted investment in the business is beginning to reap rewards. Revenues climbed 14pc to £8m.

OnTheMarket was founded in 2015 by a group of agents including Savills and Knight Frank in an effort...
description: Online estate agent OnTheMarket has suffered widening losses as it fights to take on established rivals Rightmove and Zoopla.
